memberdef.argsstring: (lbann_comm *comm, int num_parallel_readers, std::map< execution_mode, generic_data_reader *> data_readers, bool data_set_spans_models=true, bool for_regression=false)
memberdef.name: generic_input_layer

memberdef.argsstring: (lbann_comm *comm, int num_parallel_readers, std::map< execution_mode, generic_data_reader *> data_readers)
memberdef.name: initialize_io_buffer

detaileddescription.para: Get the layer type's name. A layer type name should be brief, human-readable description of the layer's mathematical operation.
Setup tensor dimensions Called by the setup function. The base method sets the dimensions of the activation tensors equal to the dimensions of the first previous activation tensor.

Setup layer data. Called by the setup function. The base method sets the previous activation, activation, previous error signal, and error signal matrices to zero matrices with the proper dimensions. Matrix buffers are pinned if needed for GPU transfers.
Define the standard view of the matrix and set it for the model Setup the effective (global) mini-batch size so that gradients are properly averaged across models.

xrefdescription.para: This functionality should probably be moved elsewhere

detaileddescription.para: Perform the computation for the forward propagation step.

inbodydescription.para: Only update the number of samples processed by this parallel reader, when it is the current root
Let each rank know this size of the current mini-batch Note that this field has to be updated before distributing the data

detaileddescription.para: Perform the computation for the backward propagation step.
Once a mini-batch is processed, resuffle the data for the next batch if necessary
Calculate how many iterations are required for training, testing, and validation given a specified mini-batch size and that the training data set is spanning all of the models.

inbodydescription.para: Setup the training data set so that it spans all models
Each model uses the entire validation and testing data sets
Setup the training data set so that it spans all models
Each model uses the entire validation and testing data sets

detaileddescription.para: Return the dataset for the given execution mode.
Return the dataset associated with the current execution mode.
Return the first dataset with a valid (non-null) datareader. Returns null if none are valid.
Return the data reader associated with the current execution mode.
Update the number of samples processed for the current execution mode.
Return the sample indices fetched in the current mini-batch.
Get the dimensions of the underlying data.

Get a human-readable description of the activation tensors. Activation tensors are stored in distributed matrices where each column corresponds to a mini-batch sample. Within each column, the data is packed w.r.t. the last tensor dimension, then w.r.t. the penultimate dimension, and so on. 3D tensors are assumed to be 2D images in NCHW format.
Get the linearized size of the underlying data.
Get the linearized size of the labels for the underlying data.
